org.dyn4j.collision

Class RectangularBounds

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dyn4j.collision.AbstractBounds
      • org.dyn4j.collision.RectangularBounds
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bounds, Transformable
    Deprecated. 
    replaced with AxisAlignedBounds in 3.1.1

    @Deprecated
public class RectangularBounds
extends AbstractBounds
implements Bounds, Transformable
    Represents a Bounds object that is rectangular.

    This class performs AABB collision detection to determine if the given Collidable is inside or outside the bounds.

    If the Collidable and the Bounds AABBs are overlapping, then the Collidable is considered to be inside, if they are not overlapping, the Collidable is considered outside.

    Since this class is Transformable, the bounds can be rotated. Detection of a shape outside the bounds is done by testing the AABB of the shape and the AABB of the rotated bounds.

    This class has been replaced by the AxisAlignedBounds class because of confusion in its detection method. The AxisAlignedBounds class better represents the intention of this class.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    3.1.1
    Author:
    William Bittle
    See Also:
    AxisAlignedBounds

      • isOutside

        public boolean isOutside(Collidable collidable)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: Bounds
        Returns true if the given Collidable is outside the bounds.

        If the Collidable contains zero BodyFixtures then Collidable is considered to be outside the bounds.

        Specified by:
        isOutside in interface Bounds
        Parameters:
        collidable - the Collidable to test
        Returns:
        boolean true if outside the bounds
